subclusters.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Driven Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative and nitrosative stress causing endothelial dysfunction and vascular inflammation, linking ROS and NF-κB activation to inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Driven Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes vascular aging driven by oxidative/nitrosative stress and chronic inflammation mediated by NF-κB, emphasizing ROS-inflammation interplay.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Driven Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative stress and cellular senescence as amplifiers of inflammaging, linking ROS, epigenetics, and inflammation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Driven Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS production, mitochondrial dysfunction, and NF-κB activation in immune cells and senescent cells driving inflammaging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP from senescent cells driving NF-κB-mediated chronic inflammation and inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP as a key driver of chronic inflammation and immunosenescence, creating a vicious cycle promoting inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links telomere shortening-induced senescence and SASP secretion to systemic inflammaging and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Attributes inflammaging to SASP from senescent cells regulated by p38 MAPK, impairing immunity and promoting chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP and cGAS-STING pathway activation by cytosolic DNA from senescent cells driving inflammaging via innate immune overactivation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation and SASP secretion as contributors to inflammaging and accelerated aging after trauma.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on innate immune DNA sensing pathways (STING, inflammasomes) and their modulation (dampening in bats) affecting inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes activation of pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) by DAMPs in neurovascular unit cells triggering inflammaging and neuroinflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes innate immune memory, inflammaging, and immune-paralysis as immune adaptation involving innate immune sensing and chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes interplay between innate immune activation, immunosenescence, and inflammaging, with innate immunity driving chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links innate immune system changes and chronic inflammation biomarkers to inflammaging, emphasizing innate immune dysregulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on systemic chronic inflammation driven by innate immune activation across multiple organ systems in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights microglial innate immune dysregulation and NF-κB activation as central to brain inflammaging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proinflammatory cytokines inducing T-cell senescence and immune remodeling, linking innate immune signals to inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes immunosenescence-driven chronic inflammation with adipose tissue cytokine secretion contributing to inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links inflammaging to immunosenescence and chronic infections, emphasizing innate immune system remodeling in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes immune dysregulation including inflammasome activation and mitochondrial dysfunction contributing to inflammaging and accelerated aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on triggers of inflammaging including DAMPs, gut microbiota dysbiosis, and immune receptor activation sustaining chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Gut Microbiota-Driven Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes gut dysbiosis as a driver of systemic low-grade inflammation contributing to muscle aging and sarcopenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Gut Microbiota-Driven Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights complement activation and innate immune responses in aging intervertebral discs, implicating microbiota and immune dysregulation in inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Psychosocial Stress-Induced Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links psychosocial stressors such as intimate partner violence to elevated inflammatory markers and accelerated inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Sensing and Dampened Inflammation Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses innate immune response plasticity and trade-offs between inflammation and longevity, focusing on immune regulation in inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation-Driven Metabolic Reprogramming Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes chronic inflammation driving metabolic dysregulation and geroprotective interventions reducing inflammation to restore metabolism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Resolution Failure and Macrophage Dysfunction Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on impaired resolution of inflammation due to defective macrophage efferocytosis and reduced pro-resolving mediators causing persistent inflammaging.
